definition: to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)

sentences.english: Shi Xiang summer Guanci apprehend came to see two people is exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 緝拿施襄夏的官差趕來，看到是精疲力竭的倆人。

sentences.english: Socialist organizations called for the culprits to be hunted down.
sentences.chinese: 社會主義團體呼籲將這些犯人緝拿歸案。

sentences.english: One who pursues a criminal or fugitive for whom a reward is offered.
sentences.chinese: 爲得賞而追捕緝拿罪犯或逃犯的人。

sentences.english: The Pakistani government is determined to seize the criminals as soon as possible and bring them to justice.
sentences.chinese: 巴政府下決心儘快緝拿罪犯，並將其繩之以法。

sentences.english: The arrest of the two drug traffickers was broadcast live on the TV.
sentences.chinese: 緝拿兩名販毒分子的過程在電視上進行了實況轉播。

sentences.english: Is it time the police to apprehend criminals do not have to pay cost?
sentences.chinese: 難道每次緝拿歹徒警察都沒有付出代價嗎？

sentences.english: The police said that it was just a matter of time before the murderer was put into prison.
sentences.chinese: 警方表示，將殺人兇手緝拿歸案只是個時間問題。

sentences.english: The criminal was seized by the police.
He was driven back to pao an with a price on his head .
sentences.chinese: 在懸賞緝拿他的首級的情況下他被迫退到保安去。

sentences.english: And there are plans to collar even more coppersnatchers.
sentences.chinese: 政府現已制定抓捕計劃，欲緝拿更多的盜銅賊歸案。

sentences.english: You son escaped, officials are brought to justice.
sentences.chinese: 你兒子逃走了，官府正在緝拿歸案。

sentences.english: Have any of the murderers been captured?
sentences.chinese: 有兇手被緝拿歸案了嗎？
